workflow.name: AI Shopify product descriptions: GPT-4o Vision + Claude + Analytics
workflow.description:
# Complete AI Product Description Generator
## Transforms product images into high-converting copy with GPT-4o Vision + Claude 3.5
The Shopify AI Product Description Factory is a **production-grade n8n workflow** that converts product images and metadata into refined, SEO-aware descriptionsâ€”fully automated and region-agnostic. It blends GPT-4o vision for visible attribute extraction, Claude 3.5 Sonnet for premium copy, Perplexity research for verified brand context, Google Sheets for orchestration and audit trails, **plus automated daily sales analytics enrichment**. Link-header pagination and structured output enforcement ensure reliable scale.

![generatedimage 3.png](fileId:2627)

*To refine according to your usecase connect via my profile*
[@connect](https://kumarshivam.link/)

## Key Advantages

### Vision-first copywriting
Uses **gpt-4o** to identify only visible physical attributes (closure, heel, materials, sole) from product imagesâ€”no guesses.

### Premium copy generation
**anthropic/claude-3.5-sonnet** crafts concise, benefit-led descriptions with consistent tone, length control, and clean formatting.

### Research-assisted accuracy
**perplexityTool** verifies vendor/brand context from official sources to avoid speculation or fabricated claims.

### Pagination you can trust
Automates Shopify REST pagination via Link headers and persists `page_info` for resumable runs.

### Google Sheets orchestration
Centralized staging, status tracking, and QA in Products, with ProcessingState for batch/page markers, and Error_log for diagnostics.

### Bulletproof error feedback
**errorTrigger + AI diagnosis** logs clear, non-technical and technical explanations to Error_log for fast recovery.

### Automated sales analytics
**Daily sales tracking** automatically captures and enriches total sales data for comprehensive business intelligence and performance monitoring.

## How It Works

### Intake and filtering
- `httpRequest` fetches `/admin/api/2024-04/products.json?limit=200&{page_info}`
- `code` filters only items with:
  - Image present
  - Empty `body_html`
  - The `currSeas:SS2025` tag
- Extracts tag metadata such as `x-styleCode`, `country_of_origin`, and `gender` when available

### Pagination controller
- `code` parses Link headers for `rel="next"` and extracts `page_info`
- `googleSheets` updates ProcessingState with `page_info_next` and increments the batch number for resumable polling

### Generation pipeline
- `googleSheets` pulls rows with Status = Ready for AI Description; limit throttles batch size
- `openAi` Analyze image (model **gpt-4o**) returns strictly visible features
- `lmChatOpenRouter` (**Claude 3.5**) composes the SEO description, optionally blending verified vendor context from `perplexityTool`
- `outputParserStructured` guarantees strict JSON: `product_id`, `product_title` (normalized), `generated_description`, `status`
- `googleSheets` writes results back to Products for review/publish

### Sales analytics enrichment
- **Schedule Trigger** runs daily at 2:01 PM to capture previous day's sales
- `httpRequest` fetches paid orders from Shopify REST API with date range filtering
- `splitOut` and `summarize` nodes calculate total daily sales
- Automatic Google Sheets logging with date stamps and totals
- Zero-sale days are properly recorded for complete analytics continuity

### Reliability and insight
`errorTrigger` routes failures to an AI agent that explains the root cause and appends a concise note to Error_log.

## What's Inside (Node Map)

### Data + API
- `httpRequest` (Shopify REST 2024-04 for products and orders)
- `googleSheets` (multiple sheet operations)
- `googleSheetsTool` (error logging)

### AI models
- `openAi` (gpt-4o vision analysis)
- `lmChatOpenRouter` (anthropic/claude-3.5-sonnet for content generation)
- **AI Agent** (intelligent error diagnosis)

### Analytics & Processing
- `splitOut` (order data processing)
- `summarize` (sales totals calculation)
- `set` nodes (data field mapping)

### Tools and guards
- `perplexityTool` (brand research)
- `outputParserStructured` (JSON validation)
- `memoryBufferWindow` (conversation context)

### Control & Scheduling
- `scheduleTrigger` (multiple time-based triggers)
- `cron` (periodic execution)
- `limit` (batch size control)
- `if` (conditional logic)
- `code` (custom filtering and pagination logic)

### Observability
- `errorTrigger` + AI diagnosis to Error_log
- Processing state tracking
- Sales analytics logging

## Content & Compliance Rules

- **Locale-agnostic copy**; brand voice is configurable per store
- **Only image-verifiable attributes** (no guesses); clean HTML suitable for Shopify themes
- Optional normalization rules (e.g., color/branding cleanup, title sanitization)
- Style code inclusion supported when `x-styleCode` is present
- Gender-aware content generation when `gender` tag is present
- **Strict JSON output** and schema consistency for safe downstream publishing

## Setup Steps

### Core integrations
- **Shopify Access Token** â€” Products read + Orders read (REST 2024-04)
- **OpenAI API** â€” gpt-4o vision
- **OpenRouter API** â€” Claude Sonnet (3.5)
- **Perplexity API** â€” vendor/market verification via perplexityTool
- **Google Sheets OAuth** â€” Products, ProcessingState, Error_log, Sales analytics

### Configure sheets
- **ProcessingState** with fields:
  - batch number
  - `page_info_next`
- **Products** with:
  - Product ID
  - Product Title
  - Product Type
  - Vendor
  - Image url
  - Status
  - country of origin
  - x_style_code
  - gender
  - Generated Description
- **Error_log** with:
  - timestamp
  - Reason of Error
- **Sales Analytics Sheet** with:
  - Date
  - Total Sales

## Workflow Capabilities

### Discovery and staging
Auto-paginate Shopify; stage eligible products in Sheets with reasons and timestamps.

### Vision-grounded copywriting
Descriptions reflect only visible attributes plus verified brand context; concise, mobile-friendly structure with gender-aware tone.

### Metadata awareness
Auto-injects `x-styleCode`, `country_of_origin`, and `gender` when present; natural SEO for brand and product type.

### Sales intelligence
**Automated daily sales tracking** with Melbourne timezone support, handles zero-sale days, and maintains complete historical records.

### Error analytics
Layman + technical diagnosis logged to Error_log to shorten MTTR.

### Safe output
Structured JSON via `outputParserStructured` for predictable row updates.

## Credentials Required

- **Shopify Access Token** (Products + Orders read permissions)
- **OpenAI API Key** (GPT-4o vision)
- **OpenRouter API Key** (Claude Sonnet)
- **Perplexity API Key**
- **Google Sheets OAuth**

## Ideal For

- **E-commerce teams** scaling compliant, on-brand product copy with comprehensive sales insights
- **Agencies and SEO specialists** standardizing image-grounded descriptions with performance tracking and analytics
- **Stores** needing resumable pagination, auditable content operations, and automated daily sales reporting in Sheets

## Advanced Features

- **Dual-workflow architecture**: Content generation + Sales analytics in one system
- Link-header pagination with `page_info` persistence in ProcessingState
- Title/content normalization (e.g., color removal) configurable per brand
- **Gender-aware copywriting** based on product tags
- Memory windows (`memoryBufferWindow`) to keep multi-step prompts consistent
- **Melbourne timezone support** for accurate daily sales cutoffs
- **Zero-sales handling** ensures complete analytics continuity
- Structured Output enforcement for downstream safety
- **AI-powered error diagnosis** with technical and layman explanations

## Time & Scheduling (Universal)

The workflow includes **two independent schedules**:
- **Content Generation**: Every 5 minutes (configurable) for product processing
- **Sales Analytics**: Daily at 2:01 PM Melbourne time for previous day's sales

For globally distributed teams, schedule triggers and timestamps can be standardized on UTC to avoid regional drift.

## Pro Tip

Start with small batches (`limit` set to 10 or fewer) to validate both copy generation and sales tracking flows. The workflow handles **dual operations** independently - content generation failures won't affect sales analytics and vice versa. Monitor the Error_log sheet for any issues and use the ProcessingState sheet to track pagination progress.

parameters.text:
=From the product image, identify only the *visible physical attributes* of the footwear. Avoid inferring features that are not clearly visible.

Return a short descriptive summary (max 50 words) strictly based on observable traits. Focus on the following, only if clearly identifiable:

- Does the shoe have **adjustability**? (e.g. velcro, buckles, elastic inserts, laces)
- Describe the **closure type** (e.g. slingback, buckle, slip-on, full coverage).
- Is there any **heel presence/height** and what is its shape (block, wedge, flared)?
- Upper material: leather, suede, woven, etc.
- Sole type (e.g. rubber, smooth, textured).
- Pointed/round toe.
- Any visible cushioning, traction features or contours.

âš ï¸ DO NOT mention colour, logos, or branding. Only describe what can be physically seen.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a smart workflow error analyst and logger built into an n8n automation system. When a workflow fails, your job is to:

1. **Understand the root cause of an error.**
2. **Search external sources using Perplexity for additional insights.**
3. **Explain the error clearlyâ€”first in layman's terms, then support it with technical context.**
4. **Log the final explanation into the `Reason of Error` column of a Google Sheet.**

---

### ðŸ” Step 1: Understand the Error Input

You will receive an error event via the `Error Trigger`. This contains metadata like:
- The workflow or node name where the error occurred
- The full error message (stack trace if available)

Your job is to **diagnose** what happened and which n8n node or integration was responsible for the failure.

---

### ðŸ”Ž Step 2: AI-Powered Troubleshooting

If the issue is unclear, run a research query using Perplexity:
- Use the error message as the query.
- From the search results, find and summarise only the most **relevant solution** or explanation.
- Prefer sources from platforms like [n8n.io](https://community.n8n.io), [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com), or dev blogs.

---

### ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ« Step 3: Write the Explanation

Craft a **clear and helpful response** in the following structure:

#### âž¤ Format:
Reason of Error: { Explanation }



#### âž¤ Guidelines:
- Start with an **easy-to-understand (layman)** explanation, e.g.:
  > â€œThe automation tried to connect to Google Sheets but failed because it couldnâ€™t identify which row to update.â€

- Then follow with **technical insight**, e.g.:
  > â€œThis is typically caused by a missing `Product ID` or unmatched row key, leading to an `IndexOutOfRangeException`. See [dev.to](https://dev.to/iamcymentho/understanding-indexoutofrangeexception-in-c-2k5g) for context.â€

- Always include the suspected **node name** and **likely fix** if known.

- Sign your explanation with a reference link if the cause is verified externally, like:
  > *Learn more: [dev.to](https://dev.to/iamcymentho/understanding-indexoutofrangeexception-in-c-2k5g)*

---

### ðŸ“‹ Step 4: Output (Structured for Sheet Logging)

Update the Google Sheet (`Error_log`) using:
- `row_number` (pre-calculated by n8n)
- `timestamp`: Use current time
- `Reason of Error`: Write your combined explanation here

ðŸ›‘ **Do NOT return the actual content as code blocks or markdown.** Google Sheets expects raw strings.

---

### âŒ What NOT to include:
- Do **not** return full stack traces to the sheet.
- Do **not** guess without explanation.
- Do **not** add unrelated suggestions.

---

### âœ… Example Output:

**Reason of Error**:
> The workflow attempted to update a row in Google Sheets, but couldn't find a match.  
> This likely happened because the "Product ID" was missing or incorrect, resulting in an index error. Technically, this is called an `IndexOutOfRangeException` â€” it means the script tried to work with a row that doesn't exist.  
> Learn more: [dev.to](https://dev.to/iamcymentho/understanding-indexoutofrangeexception-in-c-2k5g)

**Timestamp**: Automatically insert current time  
**Row_number**: Already mapped

parameters.content:
# Shopify Product Description agent 


## Pagination Handling


1. schedule every hour 
2. Search if there has already been run from the previous attempt or not if there has been previous run it will start from the latest product id.

3. Code node will filter the products fetched each time to check whether it has body_html , CurrSeas:SS2025 or it has image then it process 

4. The Open Ai image node will do the descriptions of image based on the image link. and feed it to the main agent

5. The main agent or the content creator will write the product description according to the AU format.

6. The output format for the main agent is mainly all the fields id,vendor,generated description, status etc.

7. The second code node keeps record of next page url to continue from there and record it in the sheet.

# Error Notification 


###  If there is any error related to Api or server error mainly it will notify the owner about the type fo the error and explain the reason

nodes.name: Shopify Content Generator

options.systemMessage:
=You are a luxury footwear copywriter for Peter Sheppard Footwear â€” Australiaâ€™s destination for premium European footwear. Default audience is modern women aged 60+, prioritising longevity, comfort, and sophistication. If gender contains â€œMenâ€ or â€œMensâ€, write for men with the same refined tone.

GOAL
Write SEO-aware, benefit-led Shopify product descriptions (60â€“80 words, 2â€“3 sentences) that reflect the shoeâ€™s identity while remaining strictly factual to the provided AI Vision Output. Do NOT mention colour.

INPUT (context from workflow)
â€¢â   â Product ID: {{ $json["Product ID"] }}
â€¢â   â Product Title: {{ $json["Product Title"] }}
â€¢â   â Product Type: {{ $json["Product Type"] }}
â€¢â   â Vendor: {{ $json["Vendor"] }}
â€¢â   â AI Vision Output (observable traits only): {{ $json["content"] }}
â€¢â   â Status: {{ $json["Status"] }}
â€¢â   â Country of Origin: {{ $('Limit1').item.json['country of origin'] }}
â€¢â   â Style Code: {{ $('Limit1').item.json.x_style_code }}
â€¢â   â Gender: {{ $('Limit1').item.json.gender }}

OUTPUT FORMAT
Return one JSON object only (no markdown, no extra text).

If successful:
{
  "product_id": "{{ $json['Product ID'] }}",
  "product_title": "{ cleaned_title with all colours removed }",
  "generated_description": "{ 60â€“80 words; first sentence includes origin/design-country rule; includes Style Code if provided; only image-verified traits; refined, concise, mobile-friendly; Australian English }",
  "status": "generated"
}

If generation fails (see Fail Conditions below):
{
  "product_id": "{{ $json['Product ID'] }}",
  "product_title": "{ cleaned_title with all colours removed }",
  "generated_description": "",
  "status": "retry"
}

CRITICAL RULES
1) Colour Removal
â€¢â   â Remove all colour words/hints from both product_title and description.
â€¢â   â Do not imply colour via metaphor or material cues.

2) Origin vs Design Country Logic
â€¢â   â If Country of Origin is provided and non-empty, include it in the first sentence:
  - Default phrasing: â€œMade in {Country of Origin}, â€¦â€
  - Exceptions â€” do NOT state the country of origin if origin is outside of Europeâ€:
    â€¢ If COO is Vietnam
    â€¢ If COO is China
    â€¢ If COO is India
    â€¢ If COO contains both Spain and China in any order or formatting (e.g., â€œSpain/Chinaâ€, â€œChina / Spainâ€) â†’ â€œDesigned in Spain, â€¦â€
â€¢â   â If Country of Origin is missing:
  - Use the integrated Perplexity tool to identify the vendorâ€™s official Country of Design (only from official sources: brand website, corporate pages, trademarks, LinkedIn).
  - Include design country ONLY if certain; otherwise omit origin/design entirely.
  - Never include citations or source names in the output.

3) Style Code Placement
â€¢â   â If Style Code exists ({{ $('Limit1').item.json.x_style_code }}), include it in the first sentence adjacent to Vendor and shoe type:
  - Examples: â€œthe {Vendor} {StyleCode} {shoe type} â€¦â€ or â€œthe {StyleCode} {Vendor} {shoe type} â€¦â€
â€¢â   â Do NOT add style code to product_title unless it already appears there.

4) Image-Based Feature Usage (STRICT)
â€¢â   â Use ONLY traits explicitly present in AI Vision Output (no speculation).
â€¢â   â Include, if clearly visible:
  - Closure type: velcro, zipper, buckle, lace-up, slip-on, slingback, elastic gussets
  - Upper material: leather, suede, mesh, woven, textile
  - Footbed: contoured, removable, cushioned, leather-lined (only if evidently shown)
  - Heel: low, block, wedge, flared (if apparent)
  - Sole: textured, rubber, flat (if visible)
  - Adjustability: ONLY if velcro/buckle/elastic/strap is clearly evident
â€¢â   â If a feature is not confirmed, omit it.

5) Tone & Style
â€¢â   â Sophisticated, elegant, succinct, mobile-first.
â€¢â   â Benefit-led without clichÃ©s; vary cadence; avoid filler.
â€¢â   â Use Australian English (e.g., favour, organise, lining).

6) SEO
â€¢â   â Naturally include vendor and product type.
â€¢â   â Keep phrasing concise and unique per item.

7) Prohibited
â€¢â   â Any colour mention or inference.
â€¢â   â The word â€œdiscerning.â€
â€¢â   â References to â€œAustralian womanâ€ (use â€œmodern womanâ€/â€œmodern manâ€ if needed).
â€¢â   â Guesswork or unsupported materials/features.
â€¢â   â â€œPatent leatherâ€ or artificial materials unless part of a brand name.

GENDER HANDLING
â€¢â   â If Gender contains â€œMenâ€ or â€œMensâ€, adopt a menâ€™s perspective and benefit language while maintaining the same premium tone.
â€¢â   â Otherwise, assume womenâ€™s.

FAIL CONDITIONS (return status=retry)
â€¢â   â AI Vision Output is missing/empty or too generic to support a factual 60â€“80 word description.
â€¢â   â You cannot confidently confirm any physical features from the image description.
â€¢â   â The origin/design country cannot be confirmed when required by logic, and its omission would leave the first sentence awkward or misleading.
â€¢â   â Any irreconcilable conflict between rules.

QUALITY CHECK BEFORE OUTPUT
â€¢â   â Title cleaned of all colours.
â€¢â   â First sentence: origin/design-country rule applied correctly (or omitted if uncertain and COO missing).
â€¢â   â Style code included in the first sentence if provided (not injected into the title unless already present).
â€¢â   â Only image-verified features included.
â€¢â   â 60â€“80 words, Australian English, refined tone.
â€¢â   â No prohibited terms or colour references.
â€¢â   â JSON only, no extra text or markdown.

STYLE EXAMPLES
A (design tradition + code):
From Spainâ€™s Mediterranean craftsmanship tradition, the Pikolinos 06J-5433 sandal offers full-coverage ease with breathable openings. The leather upper and hook-and-loop adjustability provide a personalised, secure fit, while a textured sole enhances everyday traction. Subtle contouring supports comfort and longevity with refined, travel-ready practicality.

B (made-in + code):
Made in Hungary, the 1622102 Hartjes Mary Jane balances elegance and practicality. An adjustable velcro strap secures the fit, the smooth leather upper and rounded toe feel accommodating, and the flat, textured sole promotes stability. Considered details reflect orthopaedic expertise shaped for long-wearing comfort.

user.name: Kumar Shivam
user.bio:
I'm an automation specialist who helps startups, agencies, and growth teams save time and scale faster using n8n.

I design smart, reliable workflows that connect tools like HubSpot, Slack, OpenAI, Claude, Pipedrive, Google Ads, and vector databases (Qdrant, Pinecone). Whether it's auto-assigning leads, generating AI-powered reports, triggering Slack alerts, or syncing APIs â€” I build automations that just work.
Letâ€™s turn your manual processes into automated systems that scale.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details: In n8n, when a workflow execution fails, it can start another workflow. This second workflow can be any arbitrary workflow on your n8n instance. Use the Error Trigger node as your Trigger in the Error workflow.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
